musicalLanguage.description: The most famous piano ballad in pop history. Lennon's simple C major arpeggiation over a slow pulse creates an intimate, hymn-like quality. The genius is in what's left out — no fills, no flourishes, just the song.
musicalLanguage.structure: Intro - Verse 1 - Verse 2 - Chorus - Verse 3 - Chorus - Outro
keyMoments: The opening piano figure: C to Cmaj7 arpeggiation that defines the entire song
The F major shift in the verse: 'Imagine there's no heaven'
The chorus arrival on G: the emotional release point
teachingGoals: Smooth chord transitions with common tones
Sustain pedal usage for legato feel
Dynamics as storytelling — building through verses to chorus
styleTips: Keep it simple — resist the urge to add ornaments
The right hand arpeggio pattern should be even and unhurried
Pedal changes on chord changes, never muddy
This song teaches restraint more than technique
